results.title: The Life cycle of the Hercules moth
results.brief_description: Follows the metamorphism from egg to caterpiller to moth. Found in North Queensland and Papua New Guinea the Hercules Moth (Coscinoscera Hercules) is the worlds largest.

results.title: The Life and art of Isadora Duncan
results.creator_credit: Ganka Petlechkova, Chicago Public Library and Office of Municipal Television Chicago Arts 49
results.brief_description: Recording of a ‘talk and dance’ performance that pays tribute to groundbreaking dancer and choreographer, Isadora Duncan, creator of what is now known as modern dance. The performance features a solo dance work by Lori Belilove, founder of the Isadora Duncan Dance Foundation and its resident company. Her dancing is accompanied by the words of Peter Kurth, author of ‘Isadora: A Sensational Life’. Their performance highlights the unique qualities of Duncan’s repertoire and tragic life, through anecdotes and vignettes. Choreography by Lori Belilove after Isadora Duncan.

results.title: The Library is...
results.creator_credit: Leonard Peck, Bro-Dart Industries and Wayne Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the history, philosophy, purposes, services and the rewards of libraries. In an interesting blend of ancient and modern, the entire sweep of recorded information - from clay tablets to computers - is pictured. At the same time the beauty of books as works of art is not forgotten. What is means to be a librarian is emphasised throughout the film. Narrated by Lester Rawlins.

results.title: The Lead matrix
results.brief_description: Shows various industrial uses of lead, including pipes, roofing, insulation against radiation, noise and vibration, caulking and sheathing, solder, printed circuits and battery plates. Lead compounds have many uses in glass, ceramics, plastics and fuel.

results.title: The Last stone = Posledny kamen
results.creator_credit: Jaroslava Havettova, Julius Hucko and Slovenska Filmova Tvorba
results.brief_description: A bitter animated joke about the frustration of being an artist in pay of the bureaucracy. A sculptor tries to impress officialdom with his most imaginative works, but does not make a hit - until the finale. The story is told with traditional animation, intercut with more experimental drawing to create geometric patterns. No narration, music and sound effects only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jaroslava Havettova, Julius Hucko and Slovenska Filmova Tvorba

results.title: The Last film search
results.brief_description: The ‘Last Film Search’ was launched officially in Melbourne in October 1981 by The National Film and Sound Archive. Its main purpose was to recover early Australian films produced on nitrate stock, so that they can be copied before the nitrate decomposes and the film stock was lost forever. Michael Cordell provides details of the search and some of his finds to date. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Kinetic sculpture of Gordon Barlow
results.brief_description: Large patterns of dominoes, each toppling the next, demonstrate the famous theory. Slowly they rise, to topple again. Brightly painted ping pong balls rise and fall in plastic boxes, and coloured cubes revolve in a changing spectrum of colour. The striking photography greatly enhances the imaginative qualities of Gordon Barlow’s work. Music by Bobby Christian, photographed by Steve Heiser and Lutz Hopke. (Award: Atlanta)

results.title: The Killer nun = Suor omicidi [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Giulio Berruti, Enzo Gallo and Cinesud
results.brief_description: A former ‘video-nasty’ and one of the few examples of the perversely themed ‘nunsploitation’ genre, which is basically a thinly veiled excuse for some soft core erotica. The usual ingredients for this genre are all present in The Killer nun, that being drug addicted nuns, lesbianism, sadism, murder, necrophilia and lashings of nudity. Anita Ekberg stars as sister Gertrude a sexually repressed, morphine addicted nun who descends into madness when her elderly patients begin to get murdered, making her the prime suspect. Soon enough the unhinged sister is shooting up, having sex with strange men and making inappropriate advances at her fellow sisters. Cast includes Joe Dallesandro, Alida Valli, Lou Castel. Also known as Suor omicidi.
